sub_title: Manager Chemometrics & Digital Chemistry at Shell
summary: Experienced Data Scientist with a demonstrated history of working in the oil & energy industry. Skilled in Chemometrics, Statistical Data Analysis, Big Data, Science, Analytical Chemistry, and Pattern Recognition. Strong engineering professional with a Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) focused in Statistics and Optimization - Chemometrics from Universidad Politécnica de Valencia.

education.degree_name: Master of Advanced Studies in Statistics and Optimization

awards.title: P&T Director's Awards - Golden Ticket
awards.description: In the category Differentiated Asset Support, this is a recognition for rapid progress from proof of concept to deployment of a non-invasive digital technology for the inspection of EO reactor tubes using imagery and chemometric solutions for assets in America, Europe and Asia.

awards.title: Power of Technology Award
awards.description: This award celebrates technical breakthroughs, exceptional deployments, successful adaptation and replication that leverage digital solutions. Working together with computational science, analytical chemistry and catalysts team, we developed a new approach to using hyperspectral imagery to identify the chemical fingerprint of manufactured catalysts. The analysis can be performed real-time using specialised camera equipment and has shown incredible promise during the testing phases of the project. The applications for this technology are very broad and the implications could be immense. in New Energies, Lubricants, Lubes, and other businesses.
awards.issuer: Shell Global Solution International - VicePresident Digitalization and Computational Science

awards.title: 2017 Extraordinary Award to PhD studies
awards.description: In recognition to research work on process chemometrics, its impact and media/social repercussion, collaboration with universities, and technology transfer. The Technical University of Valencia awards the Extraordinary Prize on an annual basis to those with a research path with proved impact on academia and industry, who received their PhD with Cum Laude and were awarded the International Mention.

awards.title: 2016 Analysis & Measurement Innovation Award
awards.description: Innovation Award to R&D work in Downstream, demonstrating clear business impact, a collaborative working style and customer involvement.

awards.title: 2015 Analysis & Measurement Innovation Award
awards.description: Award granted by the Shell Leadership Team for innovation and technical excellence on research work  conducted for refining business.

awards.title: 4th Siemens Process Analytics Prize
awards.description: Prize to a young scientist (younger than 30 years of age) for an outstanding publication in the field of Process Analytics. I have been awarded with this prestigious Prize for my research article ''Bilinear modeling of batch processes. Part III: parameter stability”, J. Chemometrics 28 (2013) 10–27". The selection of the Prize was carried out by a scientific committee of the 3rd European Conference on Process Analytics and Control Technology (EuroPACT 2014).
awards.issuer: The German Working Group "Prozessanalytik" in cooperation with Siemens

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:

- Design, execute, and maintain new R&D Data Science Program Unit under the Digital and Computational Science R&D Technology Platform, which comprises governance, portfolio management, project assessment and economical valuation, licensing and commercialization opportunities, and establishment of collaborations with Shell academic and technological partners in US, EU and India. 

- Co-governance of technical team consisting of data scientists, analytical chemists, process and chemical engineers and catalyst researchers, devoted to the high-speed delivery of multidisciplinary projects, from incubation and discovery, to demonstrate and deployment phases.

- Develop new data analysis frameworks for hyperspectral image analysis using technology in collaboration with technological and academic partners.  

- Design, implement and deploy process chemometrics methods and E2E solutions for process monitoring, prediction and monitoring for Refining Technology (Hydrocracking, Hydroprocessing, Cat Reformers, Distillation), Chemicals (SHF Catalyst, Ethylene Oxide, Polymers), GTL and Catalysis Manufacturing. 

- Leading digitalization in Chemistry using data science, statistics and chemometrics by co-designing a program with joint governance between different businesses on Digital Chemistry.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead Chemometrics & Process Analytics

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities: 

- Design and create first team driving the chemometric portfolio in agenda, grouping consultancy and R&D activities as well as accelerator projects for delivery of data-driven solutions using agile ways of working. 

- Set up external collaborations with academic and technological partners to broadening the chemometric portfolio in hyperspectral imaging for R&D catalysis and new energies.

- Develop advanced methods for big-data modeling, and implementation of multivariate statistical models for process understanding, prediction, and monitoring in delayed coking processing units.
profile_positions.title: Senior Chemometrician / Statistician

profile_positions.description:
2016/2017: 9-month assignment at Shell Technology Center Houston, Texas, United States, to develop, implement and apply state-of-the-art statistical and innovative statistic methods and workflows in U.S. Shell downstream operation.

Responsibilities:

-Provide data analysis and interpretation for research and product development projects in chemicals (SMPO, High Olefins, Polyols), Catalysis (R&D development and manufacturing), and refining (Delayed Coking, Therma Gasoil and Hydrocracking Technologies) and GTL. 

- Embed continuous improvement in Statistics & Chemometrics across locations, supporting the execution of LEAN projects, and assisting in LEAN training activities.

- Drive academic collaborations on: i) bilinear modeling techniques for batch processes, ii) Multivariate Statistical Process Control, and iii) advanced AI techniques for batch synchronization and modeling.

- Coach Bachelor, Master and PhD students in their stays in Shell and co-supervision at universities.
profile_positions.title: Chemometrician / Statistician

profile_positions.description:
Developed a PhD thesis, which was devoted to i) study the implications of the statistical
modeling approaches proposed for the bilinear modeling of batch processes,
ii) develop new techniques to overcome some of the problems that have not been
yet solved, and iii) apply them to data of biochemical processes. The study, discussion
and development of the new methods revolved around the four steps of the
modeling cycle, from the alignment, pre-processing and calibration of batch data to
the monitoring of batches trajectories. Special attention was given to the problem
of the batch synchronization, and its effect on the modeling from different aspects:
synchronization quality, changes in the correlation structure, capture of the process
dynamics, parameters stability and accuracy to detect abnormal situations.
Apart from the underlying research activities (e.g. publication in international scientific journals, presentations to international conferences and research stays in prestigious
research centers), I was also involved in statistical consultancy for REPSOL
YPF and GAMESA, developing R&D project proposals, which were submitted to
the Ministry of Science and Technology (MCYT), arranging annual
reports related to research activities from Spanish R&D projects for governmental
authorities, giving assistance in preparing material for academic lectures, and organizing
two international conferences in Multivariate Image Analysis.
profile_positions.title: Predoctoral researcher
